Posts.Content: My radio therapists just kept bleating to use aqueous, nothing else. It was so sore but they took no notice. When I mentioned it to the consultant she was extremely annoyed, and headed staight round to the department. She said they had been told not to recommend it. The ingredients of that and other similar are not indicated for this sort of use.
Posts.Title: pain and blisters after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I benefitted  so much from the advice of the others who had used all sorts of creams. The advice across the country seems to vary so much. From the "use what you feel does you good" to the "only use what we tell you" variety. Aqueous is a detergent! In the end, I got by with olive oil and Flamazine. Olive oil is an old trick for superficial burns and very good, nothing in it..
Posts.Title: pain and blisters after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: No.22?  "Stay Strong!" I've no idea what that means, but I assume they meant well!
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Don't know whether my two penny worth will add anything. We on the anal cancer forum get a lot of issues with the burns from RT. The creams the RT folks suggest are not always that useful. We get long term side effects in tissues from the RT, on the delicate inner tissues of bladder, vagina and bowel. The effects are far reaching, even to swollen legs from damage to pelvic lymph nodes.   One thing we've been debating is the use of hyperbaric oxygen to combat the effects and aid healing. There is some hopeful evidence coming out of America. Here it seems to be self funded, but it isn't mega bucks. There is an information booklet on the Mac site about it.
Posts.Title: pain and blisters after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I keep going round the house convinced I smell damp! Nothing there of course, but can make you paranoid! I couldn't bear it if I went off coffee!
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: Nah, it's not just you! And I bet you're just dying to know everyone else's weird smell experience!  Since treatment ended I have, like you, a heightened dislike of chemical fragrances. I have a friend who has a penchant for lashing on the Angel perfume! I really hate it, makes me feel sick, as does air fresheners, and the smell of the ink on newspapers!  But lurve the smell of fresh coffe, and the taste, as long as it ain't Costas!
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: I had a foul chemo mouth and the usual gels and swills from the hospital which had zero effect. So I resorted to Difflam mouthwash and strepsils extra strength. Magic!
Posts.Title: Mouth ulcers

Posts.Content: Aldi, bless 'em, were caught out in the fake Manuka honey scam. They now have small jars of the higher strength, which I bought last weekend.
Posts.Title: Mouth ulcers

Posts.Content: Gillywigs, don't go, please. You sound so bleak and sad and angry.  Please don't leave. We all really, really care what happens with you and how you are. Much love, Mary X
Posts.Title: Can good things come from having Cancer?

Posts.Content: Morning Ali, looks like your the only one up, and not at 4.30! I'm loving the advent calendar too, gives me a good chuckle! X
Posts.Title: mornin lovely ladies

Posts.Content: Hi, Ali. Just seen you're having trouble with PICC. Sorry about that. I had hickman line. No problems, but never totally sensation free. Always aware of it, but not painful. Called it hiccup. It was supposed to be for red wine, but never got round to that! My Intra vino Lino! Gone now thank goodness! Apparently hickmans can stay in for years! Hope you get sorted soon.
Posts.Title: pic line trouble

Posts.Content: I'm so glad that my hair only thinned slightly during my chemo, don't know how I would have coped with a more drastic loss. But I did laugh at the headlines in the Mail this morning. "Hair loss, the definitive pull out guide". For those of us tearing our hair out I guess! X
Posts.Title: My hair has finally decided to leave the building!

Posts.Content: I'm so glad that my hair only thinned slightly during my chemo, don't know how I would have coped with a more drastic loss. But I did laugh at the headlines in the Mail this morning. "Hair loss, the definitive pull out guide". For those of us tearing our hair out I guess! X
Posts.Title: My hair has finally decided to leave the building!

Posts.Content: I'm on 5FU, and am starting to get a sore mouth. I have a prescription for Caphosol mouth rinse A&B. Not got it yet, but the unit gave it to me as their recommendation. Plus they suggested salt water rinses after each meal. Oh, the joys!
Posts.Title: TAX - Sore Mouth - What to Eat?

Posts.Content: Afternoon Mrs D, unfortunately the sore mouth seems inevitable. I used the Difflam, found that invaluable. The Gelclair and other various things were useless. Strepsils, the strong ones were very soothing, and very frequent salty mouthwashes to keep the gum margins clean. It had to be warm though. You can make your own with 1 teaspoon of salt to a pint of warm water, and use as often as you like. I couldn't use a conventional toothbrush, electric is far the best with child's toothpaste. And it will get better! I went off tea and coffee, that was the biggest indignity.  Lots of smooth soups fairly lukewarm! Best wishes for getting through, Mary.
Posts.Title: sore mouth.

Posts.Content: They do give you the absolute worst case scenario don't they, not surprised you want to do a runner. If you look on here you'll see most folks don't suffer anywhere like that, so deep breath and dive in!  I had pelvic rads and although I did have some side effects, I got off fairly lightly. They are very good these days, and I doubt you'll notice anything for a good while. Best wishes, Mary
Posts.Title: Rads - Panic?

Posts.Content: I do sympathise, I'm not normally jittery about these things and happily had a CT and MRI after my biopsy. But when treatment finished, and I had my first MRI, they loaded me in head first, not necessary really. This particular scanner was a long one and my last scan I had gone in feet first. And this time I had a panic attack, I just couldn't face being in head first. My heart was going like the clappers! So I pressed the bell before they started mercifully, but I was right inside and could feel myself winding up! The operators response was, "did you do that by accident"! I felt so silly, but they just end turned me round, why they couldn't do that originally, the machine is less noisy that way! I would ask for a sedative, diazepam or similar prior to the next one. Best wishes!
Posts.Title: MRI claustrophobia

Posts.Content: I do so understand, I went through it when my husband had cancer, and it gets so tedious. For this reason I haven't told my friends, particularly as the treatment is short and sharp. I would be deluged with concern, which I don't want. I just want to pick up normally afterwards, without the focus being my embuggerance!
Posts.Title: Fed up of cancer being the focus ...

Posts.Content: Isn't she just, what a fantastic boost! X
Posts.Title: Yippeeeeeee

Posts.Content: Hi, I've just popped across as this rings a familiar bell. I had a course of antibiotics during treatment and within a few days had a rip roaring rash underboob, started fairly quickly, worse on one side than the other. Thrush! ....treated with Canestan, not the Canestan HC. Took a few days to clear. I self diagnosed, nurse at hospital not too helpful! GP was magic, came to house as I was having chemo too! Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Implant - red along bra line and rash

Posts.Content: Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! Oops!
Posts.Title: Slimming world/ weightwatchers while on Chemo??

Posts.Content: Hi, Ali. There are sprays like artificial tears that keep the delicate membrane inside the nose moist. As they are just topical and not absorbed, you can use them quite frequently. Best wishes.
Posts.Title: Nose

Posts.Content: Never mind the science, GIMMEE THE CHOCOLATE AND NO ONE GETS HURT!
Posts.Title: Diet & Chocolate for nutritional purposes ;-D

Posts.Content: Hi, I finished chemo over a month ago, big cheers! My previously immaculate nails have flaked, broken and generally fallen off down to the quick. And they are soft! Bleeurgh! But they'll grow, I hope!
Posts.Title: Fingernails!

Posts.Content: Lovely thread. It's a constant delight what our children and grandchildren say. Keep em coming! X
Posts.Title: A smile to start today.

Posts.Content: Lovely thread. It's a constant delight what our children and grandchildren say. Keep em coming! X
Posts.Title: A smile to start today.

Posts.Content: Well, that's an interesting factoid! Indeed, who would have thought! But it does explain a lot of the sensations that continue over the months after treatment, and the changing functions! Oddly reassuring on several levels! Happy Holiday, please may I join you? May the sun warm your aching legs, and gently energise you. Mary.
Posts.Title: Never expected this!!

Posts.Content: Just nipped in to see who's about and thought it was the Kennel Club! But lovely pics, I'm contemplating a puppy in the next couple of months, just a small one! X
Posts.Title: Dogs (man's best friends)

Posts.Content: I would, but the kids are allergic! So it's a small woolly dog! Thank you for the cutie in the cup, I might consume it by mistake, I drink a lot of tea! X
Posts.Title: Dogs (man's best friends)

Posts.Content: Thanks, Monika. I'm suspended from radiotherapy for the last 2 weeks as they've fried my bum! May well start again tomorrow. I'm not a good sleeper generally since my husband was ill, and haven't really got back into a routine. Between chemo and RT I guess anything is possible. I do enjoy an occasional nightly confab on this site, keeps a sense of perspective! And there's been some good films on!
Posts.Title: The hideous midnight hour...

Posts.Content: Oh, I so sympathise with you! I think I posted something so similar just after my own diagnosis. I became a raving hypochondriac and all common sense flew out of the window. I was convinced I had cancer everywhere from my brain to my big toe! Every little ache was another nail in my coffin! Every waking moment was consumed by my over active imagination. The reality is pretty small and mundane! And treatment is now nearly finished, and then it's back to the real world. But at the moment, sleep is pretty patchy, and like you, I'm trawling iPlayer for something to spray on my eyeballs! Happy wrestling with Dame Judi!
Posts.Title: The hideous midnight hour...

Posts.Content: Sorry you're not feeling so good. Like they say, this chemo does beat you up. Hope you haven't lost your taste for a cuppa, that's a real smack in the teeth! X
Posts.Title: propa got shakes today !!!
